attributes.action: Award an MBE to Heather Brooke, Journalist at The Times for pursuing a Freedom of Information request in order to identify the expenses being claimed by MPs; the lack of any accountability and the consequence misuse of public funds (paid by taxpayers)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Heather Brooke has recently won a 3 year campaign under the Freedom of Information Act, for the expenses claimed by 10 MPs to be made public.  It has revealed that there is widespread misuse of public money and there is virtually no accountability for the money claimed.  Whilst the MPs have (apparently) not broken any rules in making the claims they did, it is only because the system of Parliamentary Expenses is so lax. 
Heather deserves a 'Peoples Honour' for persisting with her campaign, in the face of constant opposition from Speaker Martin.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.honours.gov.uk/
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
